alert.note: Alert for Orleans (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 07 at 9:57AM EDT until April 07 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Burlington VT has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Vermont... Barton River Near Coventry affecting Orleans County. .Snowmelt will contribute to minor flooding on the Barton River. For the Lake Memphremagog...including Coventry...Minor flooding is forecast. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 800 PM EDT. && ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Barton River near Coventry. * WHEN...Until this evening. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Maple Street and River Road between Orleans and Coventry Station will flood. There will be extensive field and lowland flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 AM EDT Friday the stage was 7.96 feet. - Bankfull is at 8.00 ft. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this morning to a crest of 8.04 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage this afternoon. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
